alert.note: Alert for Harrison; Taylor (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 12:24AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong, heavy thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Taylor and central Harrison Counties through 100 AM EDT... At 1223 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong, heavy thunderstorm near Lumberport, or 7 miles northwest of Clarksburg, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Clarksburg, Bridgeport, Shinnston, Stonewood, Nutter Fort, Salem, Lumberport, Anmoore, Flemington, Valley Falls, Rosemont, Wolf Summit, Meadland, McGee, Meadowbrook and Despard. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 116 and 129. Route 50 in West Virginia between mile markers 67 and 82. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
